author: Special Correspondent
text:
Unknown persons broke into five shops in Mangadu and decamped with nearly Rs. 40,000 on Sunday night.

According to police, in one incident, Ilangeshwaran, who runs a teashop in Paraniputhur, Mangadu, had locked his shop on Sunday night. When he returned on Monday morning, he found the shutter lock broken and Rs. 20,000 kept in the draw, missing.

Similarly, the same burglars are suspected to have broken into a medical shop and stolen Rs. 7,000 from it along with a high-end phone.

The thieves also broke into a hardware shop belonging to one Tamim Ansari nearby and stole Rs. 5,000 and some money from a grocery shop belonging to Balachandran.

The police are investigating.

Television theft

A 20-year-old man was arrested on Sunday on charges of stealing a television set from a public sector bank in Avadi in November last year.

According to police, Madan alias Manmadan (20), a resident of Govardhana Giri, Avadi, was nabbed during a vehicle check. During interrogation, it was found that he was involved in motor bike theft, chain snatching and burglary in Avadi and surrounding areas.

The police have remanded him to judicial custody.
title: Burglars strike at 5 shops
